marketNews.title: World Bank October 2024 Outlook: Indonesia's Economy Revises Up to +5% YoY Growth in 2024
marketNews.content: The World Bank in its latest outlook in October 2024 revised upward Indonesia's economic growth projection to +5% YoY in 2024 and +5.1% YoY in 2025, which is +0.1 percentage point higher than the outlook in April 2024, respectively. The World Bank noted that Indonesia's future economy will benefit from several factors, including increased public consumption and investment, as well as government spending. World Bank East Asia and Pacific Chief Economist, Aaditya Mattoo, said that among the major countries in the East Asia and Pacific region, only Indonesia is able to grow in 2024 and 2025 at a rate equal to or above pre-pandemic levels.

marketNews.title: World Bank October 2024 Outlook: China's Economy Revises Up to +4.8% YoY Growth in 2024
marketNews.content: The World Bank in its latest outlook in October 2024 revised upward China's economic growth projection to +4.8% YoY in 2024, which is +0.3 percentage point higher than the outlook in April 2024. This outlook revision is supported by the recovery in services consumption and exports in early 2024. Meanwhile, China's economy in 2025 is projected to grow by +4.3% YoY, unchanged from the outlook in April 2024. The lower growth projection for 2025 is based on the continuous weakening of the property market, low consumer and investor confidence, as well as structural challenges such as population aging and global tensions.

marketNews.title: China Finance Minister to Brief on Fiscal Policy on October 12
marketNews.content: The Chinese government announced that Finance Minister, Lan Fo'an, will hold a briefing regarding fiscal policy on Saturday (12/10) at 10 a.m. local time. This announcement comes amidst a weakening Chinese stock rally after the National Development and Reform Commission—China's economic planning agency—announced stimulus weaker than consensus expectations. Previously, the National Development and Reform Commission on Tuesday (8/10) announced fiscal stimulus worth 200 billion yuan for 2025, far lower than the consensus expectation of analysts who predicted a fiscal stimulus package worth 3 trillion yuan.

marketNews.title: Old Officials From Jokowi's Cabinet Reportedly Remain in Prabowo's Economic Team
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that the economic team in Prabowo Subianto's cabinet will not be significantly different from President Joko Widodo's cabinet, with incumbent ministers such as Sri Mulyani, Erick Thohir, and Bahlil Lahadalia expected to be retained. Previously, an expert council member of the Prabowo-Gibran campaign team, Drajad Wibowo, told the Australian Financial Review in February 2024 that Sri Mulyani was highly unlikely to be in the next government's cabinet. Drajad mentioned that Prabowo Subianto and Sri Mulyani have divergent views on development policy direction.

marketNews.title: Prabowo Plans to Cut Corporate Income Tax (PPh Badan) from 22% to 20%
marketNews.content: The Deputy Chairman of the Gerindra Party Supervisory Board and brother of President-elect Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, stated that Prabowo plans to cut the corporate income tax (PPh) rate from 22% to 20%. According to the Deputy Commander of the National Campaign Team for Young Voters Prabowo-Gibran, Anggawira, this plan is aimed at increasing Indonesia's competitiveness as an investment destination, stimulating businesses, improving tax compliance, and fostering corporate sector growth.

marketNews.title: Domestic Car Wholesale Sales Declined by 9.1% YoY in September 2024
marketNews.content: Gaikindo noted that domestic car wholesale sales in September 2024 reached 72,667 units (-9.1% YoY, -4.8% MoM). Although still recording negative growth, the annual sales decline in September was better than the 9M24 realization, which dropped to 633,218 units (-16.2% YoY). The wholesale sales realization in 9M24 only met 57.6% of Gaikindo's 2024 target of 1.1 million units. Some time ago, Gaikindo had stated its plan to revise the 2024 wholesale sales target, which was set at 1.1 million units.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Projects Retail Sales Growth of +4.7% YoY in September 2024, Contracted MoM
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia projected retail sales to grow by +4.7% YoY, but contract by -2.5% MoM in September 2024. The projected decline in retail sales is based on decreased public demand due to the end of discount programs implemented by retailers for the Indonesian Independence Day (HUT RI) event. Retail sales in August 2024 grew by +1.7% MoM and +5.8% YoY.

marketNews.title: Higher Biodiesel Mandates in Indonesia Expected to Tighten Global Palm Oil Supplies
marketNews.content: Senior analyst at Oil World, David Mielke, estimated that the implementation of a higher Crude Palm Oil (CPO) blend in biodiesel by Indonesia will tighten global CPO supplies. Indonesia is currently striving to increase the CPO blend in biodiesel from 35% to 40%, which will increase CPO usage in Indonesia for biodiesel from 11 million tons to 13.9 million tons. According to Managing Director at agricultural economics consulting firm Glenauk Economics, Julian McGill, CPO is likely to trade around 4,000 ringgit per ton in 2025.

tickerNews.title: Logindo Samudramakmur (LEAD) Plans US$20 Million Debt Conversion via Private Placement, Boosting Equity and Reducing Leverage
tickerNews.content: Logindo Samudramakmur (LEAD) plans to conduct a private placement of 1.75 billion new shares at an exercise price of 186 rupiah per share to convert debt amounting to 20 million US dollars. This corporate action is intended to improve the company's financial structure and will dilute existing share ownership by 30.17%. PT Jalan Terang Samudra, OCP Asia Fund IV (SF1) Pte. Ltd., and OCP Asia Fund V (SF1) Pte. Ltd. will subscribe to the new LEAD shares, with their post-transaction ownership percentages becoming 23.19%, 2.59%, and 4.39%, respectively. Previously, these three entities did not hold any shares in LEAD. This plan will be discussed at the EGMS on November 14, 2024. Referring to the 1H24 balance sheet, this debt conversion will reduce LEAD's total debt by 20 million US dollars to 74.6 million US dollars, while equity will increase from 23.5 million US dollars to 43.5 million US dollars. With cash reserves of 7.6 million US dollars, the company's Net Debt-to-Equity Ratio will decrease from 3.69x to 1.54x. Key Takeaway: We assess this corporate action as a positive sentiment for LEAD, considering the high exercise price alongside the prospect of improved financial structure. In the last 2 years, LEAD has been unable to record positive net profit due to large interest expenses, even though the offshore supply vessel (OSV) sector has recovered and the company has successfully booked revenue growth. Assuming the converted debt has an interest rate equivalent to the blended interest rate as of 1H24, LEAD has the potential to experience a reduction in finance costs of approximately 1.7 million US dollars per year. This reduction in finance costs has the potential to drive LEAD to record a net profit of 1.25 million US dollars per FY24 annualized. Using an exchange rate assumption for the Indonesian Rupiah against the US Dollar of 15,900, this net profit is equivalent to an EPS of 3.46 rupiah per share based on the post-transaction share count. With this performance and the new share count, LEAD has the potential to trade at a P/E FY24 annualized of 33.8x. Following the announcement of this debt conversion plan, LEAD's stock price surged +26.5% to 148 rupiah per share on Wednesday (9/10). This headline was released earlier in Stockbit Commentary.

tickerNews.title: BUKA: Block Trade Transaction of Approximately IDR 2.1 Trillion Occurred
tickerNews.content: Bukalapak shares (BUKA) were recorded as being traded for approximately 2.1 trillion rupiah in the block trade market today, Wednesday (9/10). This jumbo transaction covered approximately 13.5 billion shares with an average price of 155 rupiah per share. The number of shares in this transaction is equivalent to the total ownership of API (Hong Kong) Investment Limited - an investment company owned by Ant Financial (Alibaba) - in BUKA.

tickerNews.title: ASII: Astra International's September 2024 Wholesale Car Sales for Toyota and Daihatsu Declined YoY
tickerNews.content: Astra International (ASII) recorded Toyota wholesale sales of 25,384 units (-2.1% YoY, -2.3% MoM) in September 2024, while Daihatsu wholesale sales reached 12,676 units (-15.5% YoY, -8.3% MoM). Combined, the two main brands of ASII recorded a sales performance decline of -7% YoY in September 2024, slightly better than the industry-wide realization (-9.1% YoY), resulting in their combined market share increasing to 52.4% (vs. September 2023: 51.2%). Cumulatively over 9M24, Toyota's wholesale sales reached 208,301 units (-15.5% YoY) and Daihatsu reached 125,849 units (-14.7% YoY).

tickerNews.title: BBNI: Hibank President Director Says Option Exists to Make Sea Ltd. a Minority Shareholder
tickerNews.content: The President Director of PT Bank Hibank Indonesia, Jenny Wiriyanto, stated that there is an option to make Sea Ltd. (NYSE: SE) a minority shareholder in the company. However, Jenny could not confirm when this option would be realized. Previously, DealStreetAsia reported in late February 2024 that Sea Ltd. planned to acquire 10-15% of Hibank's shares in 2Q24. Hibank is a rebranding of Bank Mayora after being acquired by BBNI in 2022.

tickerNews.title: DSSA: Director Denies Knowledge of Report that DSSA will Tender Offer Merger Result of EXCL and FREN
tickerNews.content: BloombergTechnoz reported that Dian Swastatika Sentosa (DSSA) will be the party conducting a tender offer for the merger result between XL Axiata (EXCL) and Smartfren Telecom (FREN) at a price of 3,500-4,000 rupiah per share. Responding to this issue, DSSA Director, Hermawan Tarjono, claimed not to have heard this information. Meanwhile, EXCL President Director, Dian Siswarini, declined to comment, while FREN President Director, Merza Fachys, claimed not to know the technical details of the FREN and EXCL merger.

tickerNews.title: RAJA: Subsidiary's Consortium to Lead BBM Pipeline Provision Project for Pertamina Patra Niaga
tickerNews.content: Rukun Raharja (RAJA) announced that its subsidiary, PT Petrotech Penta Nusa, will lead the consortium for the provision of BBM (Fuel) pipelining services for Tanjung Batu-Samarinda for PT Pertamina Patra Niaga. PT Petrotech Penta Nusa itself will invest according to its participation portion amounting to approximately 982.5 billion rupiah to execute the contract. The construction period will last for 2 years, with the operation and maintenance period lasting for 10 years from the commercial operation date. Besides PT Petrotech Penta Nusa, the consortium for this contract includes PT Citra Panji Manunggal and PT Bakrie Pipe Industries.

tickerNews.title: PGAS: Subsidiary Signs BBM Cikampek-Plumpang Pipelining Service Contract with Pertamina Patra Niaga
tickerNews.content: Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS) through its subsidiary, PT Pertamina Gas, signed a contract for the provision of BBM Cikampek-Plumpang pipelining services with PT Pertamina Patra Niaga. The agreement duration is 3 years for the construction period with 10 years for the operation and maintenance period.

tickerNews.title: INKP: Controlling Shareholder Purchased 18.6 Million Shares at IDR 8,600, Increasing Stake to 57.46%
tickerNews.content: The controller of Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper (INKP), PT APP Purinusa Ekapersada, purchased 18.6 million INKP shares at a price of 8,600 rupiah per share on October 3, 2024. The transaction value reached approximately 160 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT APP Purinusa Ekapersada in INKP increased from 57.12% to 57.46%.

tickerNews.title: LABA: Chairman of the Board Sold 4.18 Million Shares, Ownership Drops to 0.11%
tickerNews.content: The President Commissioner of Green Power Group (LABA), Huang Yeping, sold 4.18 million LABA shares at an average price of 598 rupiah per share on October 7, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 2.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Huang Yeping's ownership in LABA decreased from 0.49% to 0.11%.
